characters: Did you see where Eric went

dialogue.text: Thanks for tonight, cutie! So annoying that someone stole all your vamp.
But call me tomorrow, and I’ll help you get new stuff.
You said there wouldn’t be that many guests
because I live out in the countryside.
Motorbike kids. Typical.
–Yeah, right?
dialogue.speaker: But it was actually fun

dialogue.text: Affe, come on. We gotta go. You coming?
–We’re gonna clean up a bit. –We’re leaving.
–But we still have some left here, so… –Nah. Okay. Bye.
What the fuck? Eric!
Weird!
–He just left.
dialogue.speaker: Did you see where Eric went

dialogue.text: But how are you?
I’m fine. But I think I’m heading home now.
How was Eric, by the way?
He seemed down or something. What actually happened?
Nothing. Nothing happened. Thanks for a great party.
Thanks yourself.
BST!

characters: It would be nice to see you
Did you see Eric and Elise at the party
Do you think it could be Jacques
So she said that he said that she said it

dialogue.text: You’re not getting triggered, right?
Yeah, maybe a little.
–Yeah, I can feel it.
dialogue.speaker: Me too

dialogue.text: If I were you I wouldn’t do that.
What are you doing here, Alfred?
Content for your nerd channel,
or are you here to dance with my sister?
–Jack, you’re scaring him. –Good.
–That’s the point. –Jack, put that down.
I’ve warned you. At some point your actions are going to have consequences.
No!
No, no, no!
Fuck, that was fun!
–Tonight.
dialogue.speaker: When are we doing this

dialogue.text: Tonight? Are you kidding me? It looks like hell in here.
I’ve already started inviting people.
And Chloe will be here any second now.
Oh! Why do you always have to drag her into everything?
But trust me. She’s bringing the vampire.
We sell the vamp back, and we get money.
I really want you to be in, but it’s Elise.
She has her favorites for the final show.
But do you know the choreography? Are you ready?
Yeah. I just need to get hold of new vamp.
But we’ll get some. I’ll fix it.
Hey, thanks for helping me. I’ve been so worried.
It’s cool. I know how it is.
Or well, I can imagine. Kevin and Didde are super nice.
They’re just a bit dumb.
And hey, suck up to them now so we can go to their party.
So how do you even get vamp? It’s prescription only.
They’ve got their contacts somehow. But we’re not asking them.
And hey, don’t mention the nerd now.
–Yeah, Alfred.
dialogue.speaker: The nerd

dialogue.text: He absolutely cannot come along.
What's up, ladies?
–Does it look like we’re taking cards, or? –No, definitely not.
Of course we’re taking cards.
–What’s your PIN? –I’m not telling you that.
Well then, no vamp for you.
You can forget about coming to the party tonight.
Please! What choice do you have?
But… this is my parents’.
Is she getting anything or not? What kind of kid did you drag along?
I don’t know.
Okay. 2478.
You’ll get it back tomorrow.
Oh right! Here, take this too. Bring everyone you know.
I mean, all the girls you know.
–Come on! –You guys have to come.
Hand them out. Hand them out. Here.
Come on! Wohooo!
Take it easy. Here. You’re not getting any, damn it.
–Heard what?
dialogue.speaker: Have you heard

dialogue.text: What happened between Elise and Eric at the party.
What? They just messed around, right?
Yeah, but now both are pissed. Drama!
What? So he didn’t reply?
No, I don’t know what’s up with him.
But what happened at the party?
Yeah, or… No. No, nothing happened.
Something must have happened. You were gone forever.
–Yeah, didn’t you even make out? –Guys, stop!
–I don’t get why Elise is mad. –But it’s Eric.
He fucked up again, you know that.
–What?
dialogue.speaker: Did you see Eric and Elise at the party

dialogue.text: He’s such a fucking douche. So damn mean.
–Hey! Hey! –Yeah, I agree with you.
–Exactly!
dialogue.speaker: Did you dock the mothership

dialogue.text: –Yeah, come on! –Oh come on, stop!
The species Homo sapiens and Homo vampyrus…
–Homo! –Guys…
We grow up too.
Maybe he’s in love with someone else.
You? –It’s someone else, maybe.
dialogue.speaker: Who would that be

dialogue.text: –What?
dialogue.speaker: Kiara

dialogue.text: You saw how they were looking at each other at the party.
Hey. How are you?
–No.
dialogue.speaker: Have I done something

dialogue.text: But you’re avoiding me and not answering when I text.
–It’s sad when they fight. –Really.
Because they’re so cute.
Are you coming to the party tonight?
–Nice with a redneck party, huh?
dialogue.speaker: It would be nice to see you

dialogue.text: Okay, sorry.
It’s also really important that we remember
that sex isn’t just about the body.
It’s about feelings, relationships and resp…
Today’s echo at quarter to five.
Yo, yo, yo! DJ Didde in the house!
–Don’t miss the sickest party of the year.
dialogue.speaker: And Kevin

dialogue.text: Tonight in the warehouse.
Everyone with D-cups gets in free. So long, gay boys.
How did it go afterwards? How mad was he?
He calmed down, but I think he realised I’d had a party.
And the vamp doses?
Chloe helped me get new ones.
Chloe? Why the hell did you get help from her?
Wow, you’re really pissed.
I just don’t think you should hang out with her.
Oh come on. She’s nice to me.
–Weren’t you supposed to have LAN tonight? –Yeah, why?
Well, I’ve been invited to a party I really want to go to.
But it’s not like it’s super personal or anything.
So I’m skipping the LAN.
I can come to the party. It’ll be fun.
What?
No, that’s exactly it.
You’re not invited. And I’m going to Chloe’s pre-party.
Oh, okay.
–Okay.
dialogue.speaker: I have Batgirls training

dialogue.text: Shouldn’t you be stretching your legs on the kick?
Sorry I’m late.
–Yeah, imagine that.
dialogue.speaker: Are you already done

dialogue.text: –Who’s going to be in the final show? –Your suggestion is on reserve.
–What the fuck, Chloe! –What?
So Felicia and Livia manage the choreography?
Yeah, almost.
–And Siri didn’t, right? –Yeah, but she’s from Källby.
What does that have to do with anything?
It’s out in the countryside and she doesn’t have a car.
So maybe she can’t make it to training and stuff.
Why am I not surprised
that all your friends suddenly are Batgirls
and all get to be in the final show?
That’s not true. Kiara is in. She’s your friend, not mine.
Your friends don’t make the cut, Elise.
–That’s not exactly strange. –Whatever. Do what you want.
Thanks! Probably best that way.
See you at my place later then, at my pre-party.
Fuck, she’s so picky. Okay, let’s go. Five, six, seven and…
Watch out! Bump!
Kevin…
God… Nice!
No.
2478. There we go!
Receipt. Thanks.
Kiara…
Have you borrowed some of my vamp? It was such a mess in the bathroom cabinet.
No. I was looking for something.
And where were you going tonight?
Me and some friends are studying for the test.
Kiara, do you know what happened to my wines
that I was saving for my 200th birthday?
No, Dad. No idea.
You haven’t had friends over while we were away, have you?
No, absolutely not.
–Yeah. Or I don’t know.
dialogue.speaker: Do you think it could be Jacques

dialogue.text: I’ll have a serious talk with him. Those were very expensive wines.
One more thing. The bank called.
I’ve blocked your card. You have to tell us if you lose it.
Yeah, sorry, I forgot. But thanks!
–Math?
dialogue.speaker: Good luck with the math

dialogue.text: You’re studying mathematics for the test, right?
Math, yeah. Blood and honor. –Blood and honor.
dialogue.speaker: Exactly

dialogue.text: Come on! We’re late.
You’re losing control.
–You don’t get to decide over me. –You’re lying. You’re shifting blame.
–You’re forgetting who you are. –Leave me alone.
If this continues it’s going to end badly.
–Check.
dialogue.speaker: Beer

dialogue.text: –Check.
dialogue.speaker: Booze

dialogue.text: –Think check.
dialogue.speaker: Chicks

dialogue.text: –Fuck yeah, we’ve got everything. –Shit, we forgot!
–Cheese puffs.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: Fuck!
We gotta go back. When do they close?
–I think we’ll make it. –You think?
–Yeah.
dialogue.speaker: So she said that he said that she said it

dialogue.text: And he just went: “Yeah.” I knew what I was gonna say, so I just…
–You just… –Yeah, exactly. I just went: “What?”
How awkward wasn’t it when the dork asked
if she could come to the pre-party?
So awkward! –Why can’t she come here?
dialogue.speaker: I know

dialogue.text: Siri is in Batgirls, right?
–Well, she is, but… –She’s still not really in.
–She’s on reserve. –You get it?
Yeah. But Adam though. Can’t we help him buy his costume or something?
Yeah, we could, but…
Chloe doesn’t want him in, so she doesn’t want to do it.
–Yeah, exactly. –Chloe’s like that.
Same with the guys, especially Alfred.
Chloe hates Alfred, especially because he likes vampires.
–Ew! That’s so gross. –Yeah, I know.
But come on. Isn’t he always horny?
Yeah. Maybe he doesn’t like me.
What? If anyone gets turned on by everything, it’s him.
Yeah, or maybe there’s something wrong.
Yeah, probably.
Kiara, your phone.
–What?
dialogue.speaker: What are you doing

dialogue.text: Screw him.
Damn it, be here now instead. Screw that fucking party.
Everyone’s going there.
Yeah, all the idiots. They won’t let you in anyway.
We can’t just sit here nerding out. Come on, let’s go to the party.
Chicks, music, dancing!
Since when the hell did ultra-nerd Alfred Karlsson become such a party guy?
What’s wrong with you?
I don’t get it. One second you’re enemies
and then out of nowhere you’re friends again and going to the same party.
Me and Chloe, you mean?
Yeah, I’m so tired of all the Batgirls drama.
Are humans always like this?
Yeah, or human girls. It’s always like that.
What the fuck?! They stole Batgirls’ founder.
–I think bad boys are sexy.
dialogue.speaker: The guys are fucking crazy

dialogue.text: –I’m good.
dialogue.speaker: How you doing

dialogue.text: I didn’t think there would be this much…
…activity.
–Free!
dialogue.speaker: How much is this

dialogue.text: What? Why?
–Oh my god, I’m kidding. Breathe.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: Oh, that’s my song.
No one up for partying? Philip?
But he’s in the middle of clearing this level.
August? Think of the girls.
Man, the neighbours are having a hell of a time tonight.
–That’s what I’m saying.
dialogue.speaker: What are they doing

dialogue.text: Let’s go to Kevin and Didde’s party, then we won’t have to listen to this.
–We won’t get in there. –Of course…
What the fuck are you doing? What are they doing?
–They’re destroying our mancave! –What are you doing?
It’s a fucking party!
I told you we’d get in. We have to party, and Elise is here.
Okay, I’ll get the girls. You stay here.
I’ll be right back.

characters: What the hell are you doing

dialogue.text: Well look who’s here!
Weren’t you the one who doesn’t like redneck parties?
–This is Jacob anyway.
dialogue.speaker: What the hell are you doing

dialogue.text: –He won the scoring league, you know. –Yeah, I know.
–What? Nothing.
dialogue.speaker: What are you doing

dialogue.text: We’re leaving now. Come on! Join us!
Don’t be so boring. Come on.
Now we’re fucking going!
What the hell, have you been drinking, Eric? Where’s Kiara? Where’s Elise?
Fuck Elise. She doesn’t love me.
–No.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: Can’t you see how fucking fun this is?
Damn it, take a swig too, you fucking olive tree.
Fuck… What the fuck?
Wait, I’ll get more.
Wait here. I’ll get him.
Have you seen Eric? –No.
dialogue.speaker: Excuse me

dialogue.text: –No.
dialogue.speaker: Eric

dialogue.text: –Yo, Affe. –Where’s Eric?
He’s dancing with the vampire over there.
But fuck that. Screw it. Chug the bottle now, Affe.
Come on!
Alfred! Alfred! Alfred!
–Kiara, you okay? –I’m fine. I just need some air.
Kiara, are you okay?
–Yo, fuck. –Eric, what are you doing?
Eric, for fuck’s sake! Give that back.
Are you completely fucking insane? What the hell are you doing?
Elise, what the fuck? Stop it.
Kiara! Kiara, stop! Stop it!
Subtitles: Iyuno for SVT
